tell_me_about_yourself: ^Why don't you tell me about yourself?
^Well, I'm a curious and user-oriented developer!
^To me, the exciting work I've enjoyed is-
^I strongly value the creative energy of people excitedly-
^- bouncing off of each other's ideas.
^There are many talented people out there with-
^- valuable perspectives that I don't have.
^- I've found you can create some really awesome stuff.
^One could argue that I gave you some new perspective.
^Now with that pesky window out of the way you can now hear-
^and smell the beautiful world hidden behind that window tint!
^That's great... I'll be sure to enjoy the smells and sounds.
^Especially, when I'm trying to sleep and there's a draft blowing.
do_for_fun: ^What do you like to do for fun?
^I tend to get sucked into a lot of different hobbies.
^Video games are a big part of my life.
^When I find time, I also love to do game development.
^But there's a lot of things to experience out there!
^Hiking, learning instruments, taking care of my cats,
^cooking, and recently I've been enjoying bouldering!
^What do you like to do for fun, Recruiter?
^The Recruiter goes on a passionate tirade about her hobbies.
^Including the time she: volunteered and served 1000 bagels to the needy.
^When she narrowly won her local municipal's pickleball tournament.
^When she bravely lent her Ferrari to the president of the U.S.
^Although, you suspect that last one is likely a fib.
work_experience: ^What kind of work experience do you have?
^I spent about 4.5 years working at a start-up right out of college.
^We provided an immersive learning platform to other businesses.
^The service centralized on virtual reality, but I worked on a variety of things.
^There was a content creation desktop app built for Windows with C# and WPF.
^I also played a lead role in launching a new web-based content creation tool-
^- that was meant to empower the creation of branching and node based learner courses.
^That one was powered by TypeScript & React with Redux for state management.
^I also spent about last year and a half working on a more traditional web portal.
^It serviced a lot of different stakeholders within the company.
^Learned a lot about modern web development methodologies.
^We worked with TypeScript/React frontend with NextJS.
^It also gave me some experience writing backend endpoints in NodeJS/TypeScript.
^Justin notes the Recruiter taking furious notes in-between bagel bites.
^I learned a lot from different coworkers there! But unfortunately we underwent layoffs.
^And now I'm here with a broken window and looking for work!
^The Recruiter nods furiously but is unable to speak.
^She had mistimed her bagel bite. The verbal timing to respond without awkwardness, is lost.
^But she was a professional, and was used to performing under pressure.
^No words come to her mind. She gives a thumbs up.
what_kind_of_work: ^What kind of work are you looking for?
^Ultimately, I like to work in spaces that put me close to user-land.
^I instrinsically like to imagine the user experience going through anything I build.
^That, and extremely collaborative places are exciting to me!
^So game development as a software engineer has always been high on my list!
^I also enjoy the challenges of working on user design for web-based projects as well.
repair_window: ^So... how much will that window cost to fix?
^You're not going to pay to fix it are you?
